admin.description: If set, this will be the Wasm migration / upgrade admin of the BTC staking contract and the BTC finality contract

babylon_tag.description: babylon_tag is a string encoding four bytes used for identification / tagging of the Babylon zone. NOTE: this is a hex string, not raw bytes

btc_finality_code_id.description: If set, this will instantiate a BTC finality contract

btc_finality_msg.description: If set, this will define the instantiation message for the BTC finality contract. This message is opaque to the Babylon contract, and depends on the specific finality contract being instantiated

btc_staking_code_id.description: If set, this will instantiate a BTC staking contract for BTC re-staking

btc_staking_msg.description: If set, this will define the instantiation message for the BTC staking contract. This message is opaque to the Babylon contract, and depends on the specific staking contract being instantiated

ics20_channel_id.description: IBC information for ICS-020 rewards transfer. If not set, distributed rewards will be native to the Consumer

notify_cosmos_zone.description: notify_cosmos_zone indicates whether to send Cosmos zone messages notifying BTC-finalised headers. NOTE: If set to true, then the Cosmos zone needs to integrate the corresponding message handler as well

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.
